spoil.英释: to give a child everything they want, or let them do whatever they want, often with the result that they behave badly

merge.英释: to combine, or to join things together to form one thing

lobby.英释: an attempt to persuade a government to change a law, make a new law etc

bleak.英释: cold and without any pleasant or comfortable features

harsh.英释: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

erect.英释: to build something such as a building or wall

stray.英释: an animal that is lost or has no home

pause.英释: a short time during which someone stops speaking or doing something before starting again

spark.英释: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together

polar.英释: close to or relating to the North Pole or the South Pole

guard.英释: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them

stove.英释: a thing used for heating a room or for cooking, which works by burning wood, coal, oil, or gas

drift.英释: to move slowly on water or in the air

weave.英释: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom

irony.英释: a subtle form of humour that involves saying things that are the opposite of what you really mean

craft.英释: to make something using a special skill, especially with your hands

fault.英释: if something bad that has happened is your fault, you should be blamed for it, because you made a mistake or failed to do something

shade.英释: to protect something from direct light

exert.英释: to use your power, influence etc in order to make something happen

minor.英释: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

rival.英释: a person, group, or organization that you compete with in sport, business, a fight etc

trick.英释: something you do in order to deceive someone

expel.英释: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

hasty.英释: done in a hurry, especially with bad results

mourn.英释: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

virus.英释: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

erupt.英释: if fighting, violence, noise etc erupts, it starts suddenly

index.英释: a system by which prices, costs etc can be compared to those of a previous date

claim.英释: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

crush.英释: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged

prior.英释: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

blame.英释: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

flame.英释: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire

panic.英释: a sudden strong feeling of fear or nervousness that makes you unable to think clearly or behave sensibly

motel.英释: a hotel for people who are travelling by car, where you can park your car outside your room

glory.英释: the importance, honour, and praise that people give someone they admire a lot

scent.英释: a pleasant smell that something has

frame.英释: to organize and develop a plan, system etc

lofty.英释: lofty mountains, buildings etc are very high and impressive

stain.英释: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

rigor.英释: great care and thoroughness in making sure that something is correct

grasp.英释: to completely understand a fact or an idea, especially a complicated one

orbit.英释: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

yield.英释: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

slash.英释: to cut or try to cut something violently with a knife, sword etc

alien.英释: very different from what you are used to, especially in a way that is difficult to understand or accept

shift.英释: to change a situation, discussion etc by giving special attention to one idea or subject instead of to a previous one

forge.英释: to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real

quota.英释: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

vivid.英释: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

trait.英释: a particular quality in someone’s character

bribe.英释: to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you

badge.英释: a small piece of metal, cloth, or plastic with a picture or words on it, worn to show rank, membership of a group, support for a political idea etc

amend.英释: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

adopt.英释: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

drown.英释: to die from being under water for too long, or to kill someone in this way

trace.英释: to find the origin or cause of sth

bloom.英释: if a plant or a flower blooms, its flowers appear or open

check.英释: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition

moist.英释: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

rally.英释: a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

boost.英释: to increase or improve something and make it more successful

fresh.英释: good or interesting because it has not been done, seen etc before

hatch.英释: if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

solid.英释: that you can rely on; having a strong basis

shrug.英释: to raise and then lower your shoulders in order to show that you do not know something or do not care about something

alert.英释: to make someone realize something important or dangerous

arise.英释: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

bride.英释: a woman at the time she gets married or just after she is married

strip.英释: a long narrow area of land

needy.英释: having very little food or money

donor.英释: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

sweep.英释: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle

realm.英释: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

track.英释: a line of marks left on the ground by a moving person, animal, or vehicle

sheer.英释: You can use sheer to emphasize that a state or situation is complete and does not involve or is not mixed with anything else.

chaos.英释: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

stuff.英释: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

tutor.英释: to teach someone as a tutor

trend.英释: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

twist.英释: to bend or turn something, such as wire, hair, or cloth, into a particular shape

elite.英释: a group of people who have a lot of power and influence because they have money, knowledge, or special skills

slack.英释: with less business activity than usual

rigid.英释: rigid methods, systems etc are very strict and difficult to change

strap.英释: to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

aptly.英释: named, described etc in a way that seems very suitable

mount.英释: to increase gradually in amount or degree

cater.英释: To cater to a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want

coach.英释: someone who trains a person or team in a sport

breed.英释: if animals breed, they mate in order to have babies

noted.英释: well known or famous, especially because of some special quality or ability

abuse.英释: to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

board.英释: a group of people in a company or other organization who make the rules and important decisions

favor.英释: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them

shady.英释: protected from the sun or producing shade

incur.英释: if you incur something unpleasant, it happens to you because of something you have done

cover.英释: to put something over or be over something in order to hide, close, or protect it

relay.英释: if radio or television signals are relayed, they are received and sent, especially so that they can be heard on the radio or seen on television

quote.英释: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

grave.英释: grave problems, situations, or worries are very great or bad

merit.英释: an advantage or good feature of something

chain.英释: a number of shops, hotels, cinemas etc owned or managed by the same company or person

novel.英释: not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

float.英释: if something floats, it moves slowly through the air or stays up in the air

widen.英释: to become wider, or to make something wider

boast.英释: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

toxic.英释: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

tough.英释: difficult to do or deal with

vital.英释: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

ankle.英释: the joint between your foot and your leg

sneak.英释: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

trade.英释: to buy and sell goods, services etc as your job or business

slave.英释: If you say that a person is slaving over something or is slaving for someone, you mean that they are working very hard

grunt.英释: if a person or animal grunts, they make short low sounds in their throat

value.英释: to think that someone or something is important

block.英释: something that prevents movement or progress

lease.英释: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

endow.英释: to give a college, hospital etc a large sum of money that provides it with an income

datum.英释: Datum is the singular form of data

crash.英释: If something crashes somewhere, it moves and hits something else violently, making a loud noise

array.英释: An array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.

stalk.英释: a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers

eject.英释: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

axial.英释: relating to, forming, or characteristic of an axis

brace.英释: to make something stronger by supporting it

grind.英释: to break something such as corn or coffee beans into small pieces or powder, either in a machine or between two hard surfaces

marsh.英释: an area of low flat ground that is always wet and soft

cling.英释: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

album.中释: （收存照片或邮票的） 册子
album.英释: a book that you put photographs, stamps etc in

brand.英释: to burn a mark onto something, especially a farm animal, in order to show who it belongs to

lunar.英释: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

vowel.英释: one of the human speech sounds that you make by letting your breath flow out without closing any part of your mouth or throat

tulip.英释: a brightly coloured flower that is shaped like a cup and grows from a  bulb  in spring

guilt.英释: a strong feeling of shame and sadness because you know that you have done something wrong

yacht.英释: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep

elbow.英释: to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them

paper.英释: to decorate the walls of a room by covering them with special paper

sniff.英释: to breathe air in through your nose in order to smell something

bound.英释: to be very likely to do or feel a particular thing

press.英释: a business that prints and publishes books

tempt.英释: to make someone want to have or do something, even though they know they really should not

house.英释: a group of people who make the laws of a country

Islam.英释: the Muslim religion, which was started by Muhammad and whose holy book is the Quran (Koran)

troop.英释: a group of people or animals that do something together

Jesus.英释: the man who Christians believe was the son of God, and on whose life and ideas Christianity is based

waver.英释: to not make a decision because you have doubts

oxide.英释: a substance which is produced when a substance is combined with oxygen

anode.英释: the part of a  battery  that collects  electrons  , often a wire or piece of metal with the sign (+)

scope.中释: （学科、活动、书籍等的）范围；（发挥能力的）机会，施展余地；眼界
scope.英释: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

cloak.英释: to deliberately hide facts, feelings etc so that people do not see or understand them – used especially in news reports

opium.英释: a powerful illegal drug made from poppy seeds. Drugs made from opium are used to reduce severe pain.

quest.英释: to search for sth that is difficult to find

cigar.英释: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up

flush.中释: 脸红；一阵强烈情感；（流露出的）一阵激情
flush.英释: a red colour that appears on your face when you are angry or embarrassed

wedge.英释: to force something firmly into a narrow space

token.英释: a round piece of metal that you use instead of money in some machines

ivory.英释: the hard smooth yellowish-white substance from the tusks of an  elephant

yearn.英释: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

spice.英释: a type of powder or seed, taken from plants, that you put into food you are cooking to give it a special taste

bacon.英释: salted or smoked meat from the back or sides of a pig, often served in narrow thin pieces

drama.英释: an exciting event or set of events, or the quality of being exciting

usage.英释: the way that words are used in a language

filth.英释: dirt, especially a lot of it

snail.英释: a small soft creature that moves very slowly and has a hard shell on its back

graze.英释: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing

plead.英释: to argue in support of sb/sth

awful.英释: making you feel great respect or fear

peril.英释: great danger, especially of being harmed or killed

shove.英释: to push someone or something in a rough or careless way, using your hands or shoulders

lever.英释: something you use to influence a situation to get the result that you want

dizzy.英释: feeling unable to stand steadily, for example because you are looking down from a high place or because you are ill

steal.英释: to take something that belongs to someone else

entry.英释: a door, gate, or passage that you go through to enter a place

theme.中释: 题目；主题；主旋律；（句子的）主位；词干
theme.英释: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

raise.英释: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

probe.英释: to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

plain.英释: showing clearly and honestly what is true or what you think about something

greed.英释: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

pedal.中释: （自行车的）踏脚，踏板，脚蹬；（汽车或机器的）踏板
pedal.英释: one of the two parts of a bicycle that you push round with your feet to make the bicycle go forward

scrap.英释: to cancel or get rid of sth that is no longer practical or useful

scout.英释: to search an area or various areas in order to find or discover sth

couch.英释: a comfortable piece of furniture big enough for two or three people to sit on

rinse.英释: to wash clothes, dishes, vegetables etc quickly with water, especially running water, and without soap

input.英释: the act of putting information into a computer; the information that you put in

grant.英释: an amount of money given to someone, especially by the government, for a particular purpose

miser.英释: someone who is not generous and does not like spending money

blaze.英释: to burn very brightly and strongly

decay.英释: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this

verse.英释: words arranged in the form of poetry

excel.英释: to do something very well, or much better than most people

stiff.英释: (of a person or their behaviour) not friendly or relaxed

hoist.英释: to raise, lift, or pull something up, especially using ropes

shark.英释: a large sea fish with several rows of very sharp teeth that is considered to be dangerous to humans

prose.英释: language in its usual form, as opposed to poetry

awake.英释: to begin to realize the possible effects of a situation

pitch.英释: a black, sticky substance that is used on roofs, the bottoms of ships etc to stop water coming through

flock.英释: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

crank.英释: to make something move by turning a crank

hardy.英释: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

pious.英释: having strong religious beliefs, and showing this in the way you behave

maple.英释: a tree which grows mainly in northern countries such as Canada. Its leaves have five points and turn red or gold in autumn.

siren.英释: a piece of equipment that makes very loud warning sounds, used on police cars, fire engines etc

count.英释: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

cheat.英释: something that is dishonest or unfair

flask.英释: a special type of bottle that you use to keep liquids either hot or cold, for example when travelling

flake.英释: a small thin piece that breaks away easily from something else

clash.英释: an argument between two people or groups because they have very different beliefs or opinions – used in news reports

shell.英释: a metal container, like a large bullet, which is full of an explosive substance and is fired from a large gun

hover.英释: to stay nervously in the same place, especially because you are waiting for something or are not certain what to do

range.英释: to put things in a particular order or position

wring.英释: to tightly twist a wet cloth or wet clothes in order to remove water

basin.英释: a sheltered area of water providing a safe harbour for boats

baron.英释: a man who is a member of a low rank of the British nobility or of a rank of European nobility

charm.英释: to attract someone and make them like you, sometimes in order to make them do something for you

wharf.英释: a structure that is built out into the water so that boats can stop next to it

Roman.英释: a citizen of ancient Rome or its empire

forum.英释: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

video.英释: relating to or used in the process of recording and showing pictures on television

exile.英释: a person who is forced to live away from his or her own country

grove.英释: a piece of land with trees growing on it

blush.英释: the red colour on your face that appears when you are embarrassed

solar.英释: using the power of the sun’s light and heat

cubic.英释: relating to a measurement of space which is calculated by multiplying the length of something by its width and height

slang.英释: very informal, sometimes offensive language that is used especially by people who belong to a particular group, such as young people or criminals

prism.英释: a transparent block of glass that breaks up white light into different colours

flank.英释: the side of an animal’s or person’s body, between the ribs and the hip

snack.英释: a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal

pants.英释: a piece of clothing that covers you from your waist to your feet and has a separate part for each leg

clasp.英释: to fasten something with a clasp

carry.英释: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it

start.英释: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it

bugle.英释: a musical instrument like a trumpet, that is used in the army to call soldiers

curly.英释: having a lot of curls or a curved shape

sting.英释: (of an insect or plant) to touch your skin or make a very small hole in it so that you feel a sharp pain

repel.英释: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

dwell.英释: to live in a particular place

whale.英释: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

inlet.英释: a narrow area of water that reaches from the sea or a lake into the land

untie.英释: to take the knots out of something, or unfasten something that has been tied

yeast.英释: a type of fungus used for producing alcohol in beer and wine, and for making bread rise

clamp.英释: a piece of equipment for holding things together

witty.英释: using words in a clever and amusing way

stall.英释: a table or a small shop with an open front, especially outdoors, where goods are sold

mixer.英释: a piece of equipment used to mix things together

wield.英释: to hold sth, ready to use it as a weapon or tool

slide.英释: a sliding movement across a surface

hinge.英释: a piece of metal fastened to a door, lid etc that allows it to swing open and shut

cable.英释: a plastic or rubber tube containing wires that carry telephone messages, electronic signals, television pictures etc

stone.英释: the large hard part at the centre of some fruits, such as a peach or cherry, which contains the seed

shrub.英释: a small bush with several woody stems

blast.英释: a sudden very loud noise, especially one made by a whistle or horn

pluck.英释: to force yourself to be brave and do something you are afraid of doing

thigh.英释: the top part of your leg, between your knee and your hip

hound.英释: a dog that is fast and has a good sense of smell, used for hunting

vault.英释: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church

tower.英释: to be much taller than the people or things around you

olive.英释: a small bitter egg-shaped black or green fruit, used as food and for making oil

extra.英释: an amount of something, especially money, in addition to the usual, basic, or necessary amount

plump.英释: slightly fat in a fairly pleasant way – used especially about women or children, often to avoid saying the word ‘fat’

split.英释: a serious disagreement that divides an organization or group of people into smaller groups

handy.英释: easy to use or to do

valve.英释: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

spite.英释: a feeling of wanting to hurt or upset people, for example because you are jealous or think you have been unfairly treated

windy.英释: (of weather, etc.) with a lot of wind

halve.英释: to cut or divide something into two equal pieces

ferry.英释: to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

tease.英释: to laugh at someone and make jokes in order to have fun by embarrassing them, either in a friendly way or in an unkind way

jelly.英释: a soft sweet food made from fruit juice and gelatin

telex.英释: a message sent or received by telex

steak.英释: good quality beef, or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat

smash.英释: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

snore.英释: to breathe in a noisy way through your mouth and nose while you are asleep

smart.英释: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

prick.英释: a slight pain you get when something sharp goes into your skin

adore.英释: to love someone very much and feel very proud of them

punch.英释: a metal tool for cutting holes or for pushing something into a small hole

offer.英释: if an opportunity to do something offers itself, it becomes available to you

brood.英释: to keep thinking about something that you are worried or upset about

lathe.英释: to shape, bore, or cut a screw thread in or on (a workpiece) on a lathe

reign.英释: the period when someone is king, queen, or emperor

haunt.英释: if the soul of a dead person haunts a place, it appears there often

visit.英释: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

unfit.英释: not good enough to do something or to be used for a particular purpose

barge.英释: a large low boat with a flat bottom, used for carrying goods on a canal or river

villa.英释: a house that you use or rent while you are on holiday

grief.英释: extreme sadness, especially because someone you love has died

storm.英释: to suddenly attack and enter a place using a lot of force

siege.英释: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

liner.英释: A large commercial ship or airplane, especially one carrying passengers on a regular route.

blind.英释: a covering, especially one made of cloth, that can be rolled up and down to cover a window inside a building

white.英释: belonging to the race of people with pale skin

idiot.英释: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

dwarf.英释: an extremely small person, who will never grow to a normal size because of a physical problem; a person suffering from dwarfism

stout.英释: fairly fat and heavy, or having a thick body

ought.英释: You use ought to have with a past participle to indicate that although it was best or correct for someone to do something in the past, they did not actually do it.

gross.英释: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

heave.英释: to pull or lift something very heavy with one great effort

panel.英释: a group of people with skills or specialist knowledge who have been chosen to give advice or opinions on a particular subject

drain.英释: if liquid drains away, it flows away

spill.英释: a fall from a horse, bicycle etc

perch.英释: a branch or stick where a bird sits

clown.英释: someone who wears funny clothes, a red nose, bright make-up on their face etc, and does silly things to make people laugh, especially at a circus

chord.英释: a combination of several musical notes that are played at the same time and sound pleasant together

growl.英释: (of animals, especially dogs) to make a low sound in the throat, usually as a sign of anger

shaft.英释: a long handle on a tool, spear etc

ranch.英释: a very large farm in the western US and Canada where sheep, cattle, or horses are bred

grope.英释: to try to find something that you cannot see by feeling with your hands

squat.英释: to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet

fling.英释: to throw something somewhere using a lot of force

scrub.英释: if you give something a scrub, you clean it by rubbing it hard

tread.英释: to put your foot on or in something while you are walking

crack.英释: to make a quick loud sound like the sound of something breaking, or to make something do this

swell.英释: to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body

infer.英释: to form an opinion that something is probably true because of information that you have

repay.英释: to pay back money that you have borrowed

scoff.英释: to laugh at a person or idea, and talk about them in a way that shows you think they are stupid

xerox.英释: to make a copy of a letter, document, etc. by using Xerox or a similar process

sneer.英释: an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone
